alert.note: Alert for Chautauqua; Erie; Wyoming (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 25 at 1:20AM EDT until July 25 at 4:15AM EDT by NWS Buffalo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Buffalo has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northeastern Chautauqua County in western New York... Southern Erie County in western New York... West Central Wyoming County in western New York... * Until 415 AM EDT. * At 120 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Dunkirk, Hamburg, East Aurora, Evans, Boston, Eden, Colden, Orchard Park, Silver Creek, Angola, North Collins, North Boston, Derby, Angola on the Lake, Billington Heights, Evangola State Park, Wales Center, Varysburg, Holland and Sheldon. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
